definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: My horse is dead beat , and I can't get him no further than the stable.
sentences.chinese: 我的馬太累了，我不能把它趕到比馬房更遠的地方。

sentences.english: In the Winter the hens laid few enough eggs. They huddled in the corners of the barn and she kept watching them.
sentences.chinese: 在冬天裏，鳮下蛋也少了，鳮擠在馬房的角落裏。

sentences.english: The barbarians defiled the church by using it as a stable .
sentences.chinese: 這些野蠻人褻瀆神靈，把教堂當馬房。

sentences.english: Some people slept on hay in barns where they kept their farm animals.
sentences.chinese: 有的人睡在馬房的乾草上，他們在那裏飼養牲畜。

sentences.english: Each of us carried one baby goat to her stable .
sentences.chinese: 我們一人抱一隻小羊去她馬房。

sentences.english: She slipped out the door and disappeared into the dark barn .
sentences.chinese: 她一溜煙走出門外，隱沒在馬房的黑暗中。

sentences.english: The hinge of history is on the door of a Bethleham stable. (Ralph W.
sentences.chinese: 歷史的樞紐，是裝在伯利恆一扇馬房的門上。

sentences.english: She's content to sleep in a barn.
The stable is a mile away.

definition: the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
Liu Bei's five great generals in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, namely: Guan Yu 關羽|关羽, Zhang Fei 張飛|张飞, Zhao Yun 趙雲|赵云, Ma Chao 馬超|马超, Huang Zhong 黃忠|黄忠
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
